website_summaries.verdict: This anvil-style lopper is an affordable alternative to the traditional bypass loppers, better suited for thicker growth and larger limbs. May be too heavy for casual users but good for professionals.
pros: Blades can be resharpened by hand
Anvil design, cuts thicker limbs than bypass
Fiberglass handles will not corrode or bend
cons: Blades can break on limbs larger than 1.5 inches thick

customer_reviews.title: Issues with the Handles.
customer_reviews.text: The Shear cuts well. The hollow fiberglass handles are weak, and the cheap foam grips slip right off the handles. Why do I have to FIX darn near everything I buy today? I'm sick of cheap stuff. Let's get back to manufacturing in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Blade broke after little use.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn out many different brands and styles of loppers over the years but never had one simply break a blade before. True the blade is available separately, but when it costs more than a new lopper why would anyone purchase just a piece of it? The blade is still sharp and new looking. Trying another brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: bearhollow

customer_reviews.title: Used it just a few times until the blade itself ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it just a few times until the blade itself broke 1" from the tip on a tree limb. Wear and tear over time of use is one thing, but after just a few uses? Limited warranty requires sending the tool back on your dime. They do have replacement blades, but almost as much as the tool itself. Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lance L

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two Cororna anvil clippers (both with metal handles) and have been extremely pleased with them. I bought these for my son and we used them for the first time this weekend at our place. The FIRST 1 1/2" branch we tried to cut and look what happened. These are junk. If you buy, make SURE you buy the ones with metal handles.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: The foam rubber will crack, peal, break off with the first use. The blades are okay if you're cutting anything 1" or less in diameter. This is not a "heavy duty" product. You'll get a few uses out of it, and that's about it. The blades are not very tough and ours have several large gouges in them from cutting brush and small dead branches over a two day period. It's inexpensive for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Beejay

customer_reviews.title: Corona fl 3420
customer_reviews.text: Junk broke 2 time I used it on a 1 1/4 branch can't send back because return policy exceed by 4 days ..new bale cost $4 less than buying new loppers. .won't buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Cossey

customer_reviews.title: Worst. Lopper. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Fiberglass handle cracked at the rivets connecting the blade on its very first day of use, on one small (1/2") dry branch. Have had similar quality/sturdiness issues with other Corona tools in recent years, such as pole pruners. With 40 years of landscaping and gardening experience, trust me when I say: don't waste your money, time and frustration on cheaply built tools like I did here. Metal handles are a must.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Rock

customer_reviews.title: Finally purchased a lopper that works great
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many other lopper brands over the years and was never happy with the way they cut until I bought the Corona brand. I'm an avid lawn guy so having the right equipment is important because I don't have time to fight with malfunctioning lawn equipment. Yeah I know it sounds stupid but when you want to just get one more task done before the sun goes down and then tiurns into a project because the dumb loppers won't cut is annoying. These just work, they are lightweight and the perfect length for the branches I'm cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Kuntzelman

customer_reviews.title: Big bite takes care of larger branches
customer_reviews.text: Only bad feature is actually a good feature: the handles are wood and long. That's great for muscular people. I'm not. But I love these. I've broken plastic handled ones in the past as well as the cutter being able to handle too small branch. These take a big bite and close and chop easily. But they are heavy when working overhead. So, maybe for me I need to spend a bit of time at the gym lifting, lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Alvena Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for anything other than light duty
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item because of the anvil design being a heavier duty option than bypass loppers. However, upon receiving the item, I noticed the plastic, composite bracket that attached the handles to the cutting head looked suspect from the start. It is attached with two rivets on each handle. On my item, one of the rivets was already almost pulled through the plastic bracket. Sure enough, after repeated use on live cedar tree branches (we kept within the 1.5 " diameter), the loppers are already wore out. Less than 1.5 months of use, and the bracket flexes on branches that it should just cut through with little to no effort.
customer_reviews.author: robbymcc

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and the foam grips slip!
customer_reviews.text: These things are sturdy enough and have good power but they are very heavy and clunky. What really bothers me is that the foam grips on the handles keeps slipping up the handles. Seems like they should be glued to the handles so they don't move. I will maybe try some hot glue on them. For the price they are adequate and I will have to see how long they last. I don't over stress my tools so they may last although that thin blade worries me! I try to make sure there is no sideways pressure on the blade when cutting branches.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed up a few crepe myrtle trees and cane poles with this. I could snip a limb or cane as thick as a roll of nickels with virtually no energy. Roll of quarters, a little snap movement and done. Roll of half-dollars, took a bit more juice, but well within these chompers ability. So far so good. I'll update if they malfunction or break.
customer_reviews.author: D.K

customer_reviews.title: These Work Great...very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of trail clearing work. I broke 2 pair of brand name long handled loppers within 3 days cutting 1-1.5" diameter oak tree branches. I bought some Corona Anvil long handled loppers and have used them for 4 years clearing trails, cutting similar sized branches. They are scratched and worn, but still function great. I bought the second Corona Compound Action Anvil Lopper for those helping me on trails. These Corona Anvil long handled loppers are great.
customer_reviews.author: brooks w booker III

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Looper did nice job of pruning branches but it was a bit heavy for me. I just used it a few times and the blade got a nick in it. Tried to fix it but a gap remained. After that it was frustrating to use. Not a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Hermelinda Flores

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Homeowner Use
customer_reviews.text: We use these loppers for our habitat restoration work at the Nature Conservancy's Ives Road Fen Preserve. They can cut a fairly large bush or sapling. After 100 hours or so of use the linkages wear. After more hours the fiberglass handles become flexible and fracture where the rivets go through them. We have figured out how to rebuild/repair both of these areas. In seven years two blades have broken. Replacement blades can be purchased from the Corona website. A homeowner using these would have no problems in a lifetime of use. These are the best combination of high capability and low cost that we have found. The anvil type blade can be easily sharpened with a hand-held angle sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Not American made anymore
customer_reviews.text: I bought these loppers to replace an old pair of the exact same model because of a broken handle. My original set was American made and these new ones are made in China. I can see a definite difference in quality, the new ones being a bit cheaper looking and feeling. Overall the loppers are sufficient for yard work, not industrial service, but heavy enough to tackle any job you may encounter around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila L. Handres

customer_reviews.title: they cut pretty well but they flex a lot when cutting bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: they cut pretty well but they flex a lot when cutting bigger limbs. the rubber on the handles lasted about four hours before i just took it off. it was junk and better without it. these are not the best cutters i have used but they are good enough for what i need. if i ever buy another pair i dont think i would buy these again. i dont think they are worth the price i paid.
customer_reviews.author: Diehard

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight compound lopper
customer_reviews.text: The good: lightweight and reaches deeply into dense bushes. Cuts large wood with ease. Can use for hours without fatigue. The bad: handles flex a bit. Foam pad slips a bit. The blade could use a little support as it veers on big cuts which dulls blade. Despite the bad, my first lopper of the same model lasted over a decade of heavy use. I'm happy to replace with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Getting my money worth
customer_reviews.text: Been cutting a lot of brush, pruning trees, etc and this does the job very well. LIght, sturdy, and no signs of any wear or trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Humble Servant

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Works better and with much less effort that non-compound pruners. Any negative comments about not being able to cut through 1 1/2" branches is questionable because they will, but you made need to cut one side then the other if the branches are hardwood or dead very dry wood. If common sense is used they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: k4zmb

customer_reviews.title: Great lopping shears
customer_reviews.text: These shears have been better than I expected, sturdy, lightweight, and very powerful. I have used them to cut dry limbs in excess of 1" and they have worked flawlessly. I have been able to use them in tight places, and the jaws open a long way even when there is not much room to open them. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Duane C

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut as described
customer_reviews.text: Does not cut as described Not for branches more than 1inch in diameter
customer_reviews.author: Li'l Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Really helps cut thick branch
customer_reviews.text: Had an old craftsman set for 7 years and it just bent. These new Corona cutters are very strong. I wws easily cutting through one inch thick branches with very little effort. Big upgrade. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time! I used to have to fight with my old, smaller one (different brand) and before long there was a nick in the blade and it needed sharpening whenever I needed to prune. This one is a workaholic and I'm thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I like the "anvil" style lopper as I can cut in tighter/narrower spaces than I could with other loppers that required a "wide berth" before it would cut what I needed to cut.
customer_reviews.author: OUMA74

customer_reviews.title: Good cutting surface. Could do with sturdier handles.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well to cut branches. The handles flexes which trying to cut harder branches. Maybe that helps prevent too much pressure transfer to the jaws or keeps the weight light, but it ended up giving it a flimsier feel for me.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Pretty light weight. Been using it almost every weekend to take down a bunch of bushes at a new home. Many of the branches were as thick as 2 inches. I'd say the tool is great for branches up to 1.5 inches to cut comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio_PL

customer_reviews.title: Grip foam slides up handles easily!
customer_reviews.text: Grip foam is sliding up handles after 5 weeks :/ Blades require sharpening every dozen hours of use. Sounds like it might break in half when cutting thicker branches.
customer_reviews.author: Ayana S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Most hardware stores carry the half moon type blade which is a hassle. Unless the branch is in the middle of the blade, it takes couple of tries to cut. This looper straight blade will cut at any angle . Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: melemel

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a good replacement for my old anvil pruners that won't tear up the tree branch when cutting. This one works great. Now there's a much better chance the tree cut will heal properly so disease and pests don't enter the wound.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Nipp

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. These are a great tool to remove useless shrubs/small trees and dead wood. Remember that anvil loppers should not be used to prune healthy wood on plants since it does not create a clean cut like bypass loppers. Also, there are a lot of review complaining about the cutting capacity. While it states that the cut is 1.5", you should never attempt to cut anything that big with these loppers. You should definitely use a pruning saw for anything an inch or larger. These are really ideal in the half inch range.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saltiel

customer_reviews.title: Not the very best but pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I cut a bunch of tree limbs and while it wouldn't cut the thickest, it cut 95% of what I needed and made my life easier. I would buy this again and its worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: It’s very sharp, works well, but the foam grip split the first day.
customer_reviews.text: I really didn’t want to give a bad review. These work great, they’re very light, however the foam grip split the very first day upon use. I have tried to contact the seller but it’s virtually impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Great Loppers for most Jobs!
customer_reviews.text: Great loppers! Little heavy but definitely strong and sturdy enough for over inch large saplings!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron V

customer_reviews.title: The Wars to Come..
customer_reviews.text: Well it does what is supposed to do like most Corona products. I bought for the endless war against the bamboo along my driveway.. but alas inevitably, the bamboo will outlast this tool and the tool using it
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Functions Well, But Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Used a few months, works okay. Issue is weight, designed for young guys with huge hands who can work with heavy-ish tool overhead. Here a test: Hold a skill saw above your head and pretend you’re in a tree of bush for 20 minutes. - I’ll need to buy a ratcheted loppers soon.
customer_reviews.author: venture

customer_reviews.title: super sharp love the anvil cut
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in timely manner. These loppers are extremely sharp. Ive used them today & they easily cut 1-1/2 inch limbs & saplings. Handles are long enough for good leverage & reach. Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: Easy and light
customer_reviews.text: I can’t attest to long term durability but they are so light and just a breeze to use. I love them and wish I hadn’t make my last crap pair last so long!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Construction
customer_reviews.text: These loppers are terrific. Will cut through any branches up t 2". Great leverage on handles to make the cut. Bought this because I was using my neighbors - he has same ones and they are amazing. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John - St. Charles Il

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. blades are cheap. I had a ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. blades are cheap. I had a clipper for 30 years & the blade has never broken. This one broke in less than a year!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Handles worked loose after a week of heavy use
customer_reviews.text: The blade and mechanism worked fine but after a week of heavy use cutting limbs within the design range of the shear the handles began to work loose at the point of attachment to the metal cutter. Now only usable for cutting 1/2 inch or less.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Via

customer_reviews.title: Anvil, Bypass, or Both?
customer_reviews.text: These loppers are perfect for cutting brittle dead wood but are not good for making clean cuts on live branches. You also need a pair of bypass loppers if you care about the health of a living plant that you are pruning. Unfortunately the bypass loppers are not ideal for both jobs. They will quickly dull if you use them to cut dead brittle branches. I therefore wound up with both of these loppers and a pair of Fiscars bypass loppers of similar size. Both are excellent tools and have a 3 to 1 mechanical advantage that makes it incredibly easy to cut large branches.
customer_reviews.author: WilliWu

customer_reviews.title: Its my second pair
customer_reviews.text: The first ones lasted 12 years of heavy duty cutting. Blade finally broke in a 1.75 inch oak branch. decided buying a new pair was better deal than replacing blade only.
customer_reviews.author: Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy it! Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been through a lot in my garden and it has really held up so well. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Janette

customer_reviews.title: Well built tree trimmers
customer_reviews.text: These trimmers have very nice leverage allowing you to cut some thick branches with it. It is very well built and I recommend this if you are looking to purchase some tree trimmers for your home.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: Good use save money in landscaping
customer_reviews.text: My husband was really happy with the product really easy to use and help to trim all The trees .
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Love this lopper
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this in my yard and love them. Easy to use and they work great. They are bit heavy but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Leona B.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because of the handle covers; they slide up the handles when being used. Cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Why Didn't I Buy This Sooner?!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Seller's price point was phenomenal! Corona really makes quality products. The Corona FL 3420 Compound Action Anvil Lopper with Fiberglass Handles is a must for gardeners! It is easy to handle and cuts through pretty big branches, etc. The handle is soo comfortable, so even little hands can use this product successfully! The length of the handles makes it so easy to reach branches that seem out of reach. Would highly recommend this product for all gardeners, professional or amateur such as myself!
customer_reviews.author: JeMicheSunshine

customer_reviews.title: had to have another set
customer_reviews.text: been clearing land and bought a set of these loppers. they have been fantastic and have really held up. I have a friend bought the property next to mine so this was his land warming gift. really god design for the mechanical advantage. Not just a single bolt fulcrum. awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of three

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use - cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed at how easily it cut some of the larger branches. Nice sturdy quality. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rryan437

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and effective for even thick branches
customer_reviews.text: We have been very impressed with this tool so far. Easy to use and effective for even thick branches. Seems to be high quality and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cuts 1 1/2" as stated. Strong, study lopper. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: egt45

customer_reviews.title: It is virus free, Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great lopers Quality product. Buy it, their name is working against them at the moment .
customer_reviews.author: W N Carl

customer_reviews.title: It Cuts!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent and sturdy lopper. Easily cuts through 1.5 inch limbs. Note for women and older men, it is not light and will make you arm weary eventually. The manufacturer should look at ways to lighten it without reducing the sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quaility Loppers and super price
customer_reviews.text: These Corona Loppers are well built, sturdy, easy to use and at a price I can't beat any other place. Bottom line: A Quality product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Baker

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It allows me to cut tree branches easily without much effort. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Taeho Jung

customer_reviews.title: finally after several years of tough work, i finally ...
customer_reviews.text: finally after several years of tough work, i finally broke a handle, there are limits as to what it can be expected to handle. i ordered another. this one
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: By far the best I've ever seen, used or owned. Sturdy, powerful and very effective. I highly recommend these cutters!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy for women to use.
customer_reviews.text: Found them heavy for a woman to prune above arm height. Don’t really like the anval style. Other than that very good quality. Just didn’t work for me af75 years old and love to work in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Very dissatisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, well made
customer_reviews.text: One of my favourite tools for years, still good Corona quality
customer_reviews.author: Richard H Erdrich

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The web site describe it different than what I received
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Cuts thick branches great!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like butter!! A little heavy but still do the job great!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Zappala

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Have been able to trim branches from trees in my yard. Good quality and not taxing for an older person.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good leverage, cut 1-2" brush and branches with ease. Padded handles are easy to grip, best loppers I have owned and I've had a good many.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J Maki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shears...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shears for shrubs and small tree limbs. As a woman, I found them easy to handle and yet sturdy enough to do the jobs I need to do! Nice and sharp. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Adsrtrose4u

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy ****but well made does the job except after using it for a couple of weeks the sponge type handle moved
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy C from La Quinta

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These compound action lopers cut through 1/2" branches beautifully and with little exertion.
customer_reviews.author: Paul LaFontaine

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is well worth the price. A lot of bang for your buck with this!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Leverage Baby
customer_reviews.text: These are professional grade chompers with great leverage! I can whack down tons of foliage in a few bites. Chomp, chomp!
customer_reviews.author: PJK

customer_reviews.title: Great for use
customer_reviews.text: Wow can’t believe how sharp and the width of tree limbs it can cut threw
customer_reviews.author: AMBER W.

customer_reviews.title: "Corona" Quality Continues
customer_reviews.text: "Corona" has always been recognized as a premium quality anvil cutter lopping shears. I have been a landscape business proprietor, and at least 5 associated landscape business owner associates agree that this is a great garden tool and a very good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 100MarkM59/ Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to prune the lower branches of cedar trees that are too small for a chainsaw but too tough for a bypass lopper. These are the best I have yet to find.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easily got the job done!
customer_reviews.text: These easily got the job done! I needed to cut my neighbors overgrown branches. I got it done in minutes with these.
customer_reviews.author: WorkerBee

customer_reviews.title: Even a 100 pound weakling can use it
customer_reviews.text: I am a small person and it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McKenry

customer_reviews.title: Action smooth as butter!!!
customer_reviews.text: My old anvil lopper was dying a slow death. I had sharpened it enough that the jaws would not quite come fully closed and to watch me gyrate and twist to complete a cut on a branch probably would be amusing to watch. This new lopper does not require much upper body strength to operate and branches too large for its jaws probably need a saw anyway. I love it and wish I had bought it sooner rather than have wrestled with the old one for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: The anvil was gashed and no no longer cut good. It was just about as cheap to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lopper because I had accidentally cut some metal with an identical lopper that I have had for years. The anvil was gashed and no no longer cut good. It was just about as cheap to buy a new lopper rather than buying a new anvil and paying shupping. It is hard to beat this lopper. Just don't cut any metal. This tool should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This clipper works great on smaller limbs
customer_reviews.text: This clipper works great on smaller limbs, but the handles could be a bit longer to use on larger branches. So far, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith sr

customer_reviews.title: Large lopers
customer_reviews.text: Suitable for what I need exactly-trimming my large rose bushes and large shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn  Stronach

customer_reviews.title: Good clippers
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one I wore out. A new one was the same price as replacement parts for the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sue
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase a little heavy for you to hold for along time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The anvil cut is what you want for thicker branches!
customer_reviews.text: Replaces a set of by-pass loppers that mangled branches more than cut them. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: a'dam

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, gets the job done. Would probably buy from them again
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Cut OK
customer_reviews.text: Handles too short and will not close enough for storage.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Corona FL 3420 Lopper
customer_reviews.text: The blades had straight edges just like I needed them to be. At 76, I need something that is easy to use. Most loppers have a hooked blade that requires them to be opened much wider than this one does, making it more difficult to get into a tree to trim the branches. This one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Great product cheaper than identical item at the Big box store
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Kobeszko

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: This tool looks impressive and works extremely well. Cuts sharp & clean with minimal effort. It's used more than expected. Even my gardener borrowed it.
customer_reviews.author: storyteller312

customer_reviews.title: Corona makes good equipment, so I keep buying it.
customer_reviews.text: The loppers work well - I've been using them for several weeks at home and where I volunteer. (The other volunteers like to borrow my Corona tools!) A minor problem is that the padding on the handles that is supposed to reduce fatigue and muscle shock creeps up the handle toward the cutting head. I will add something that will help keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: ProdigalPruner

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This should last for years. My previous Corona Lopers were stolen, and the high quality was part of the reason.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. STRAUB

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I got these loppers. I've used multiple Corona products and they are always high quality. I really like the extendable handles to let me get to stuff that is just out of reach from the ground so I don't have to drag out a ladder. They are very sharp and cut through limbs quite easily. I look forward to using these for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lopper. Cuts through anything that can fit. Well made
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Light for larger lopers
customer_reviews.text: I love these Lopers their light for the size of a branch there capable of cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert Jolly

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER!
customer_reviews.text: My old Corona loppers lasted over 20 years. Thank goodness that they still make the same ones. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made. Cuts through 1 inch branches like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: These work so well, my brother with his many years of experience couldn't keep up with his chainsaw while trimming a fallen tree. After realizing these worked faster than his saw, he went and sat down shaking his head. The only issue I've had is the foam handles lost their glue and slip on the frame now. Otherwise they impress.
customer_reviews.author: Writing from experience

customer_reviews.title: Look to be of good quality. Very light
customer_reviews.text: Look to be of good quality. Very light. Lots of cushion on the handles. I'm worried about the metal that does the work though.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Cut through nearly anything
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty clipper. Can cut right through branches and vines up to 2 inch as long as they are still green.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: Very nice loppers
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I needed actuall better than I expected. Long handles and a stron blade made trimming up trees a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Michael R DeBaun

customer_reviews.title: Garden tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I have been using it for the last few days.
customer_reviews.author: Radmila Jevicki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are nicely made (not cheap at all) and I was able to purchase them at a reasonable price with free shipping. The best thing about them is that they cut beautifully and I'm not a very strong person so this makes my job so much easier. The bright color allows me to find them after I leave them in the leaves. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lotsofcrome

product_meta.title: Corona Compound Action Anvil Lopper, 32 Inch, FL 3420,Black
product_meta.description:
Corona Compound Action Anvil Looper are long-handled pruning shears that require two hands to use, providing additional leverage while making larg cuts. Loppers are useful for pruning hard-to-reach or thorny growth and cutting up discarded branches for the green waste bin.

AMAZON.COM
Founded in the early 1920s, Corona is a leader in the marketing and manufacturing of professional and consumer tools for the lawn and garden, landscape, irrigation, construction and agriculture markets. With a retail and distribution network that extends throughout the United States and Canada, Corona’s proven designs, quality manufacturing processes and unparalleled customer service make it the best choice in tools for contractors, agricultural professionals and avid gardeners alike. Limited lifetime warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
